channel.title: [PI] Making items PKP to Wear [Medium]
channel.description: This seems like an medium task, so I want like vestas on my spawn server to take 1k pkp to wear. How?

item.title: [PI] Making items PKP to Wear [Medium]
item.dc:creator: @Roxee Roxee™
item.description:
@Roxee wrote:

yeah fixed hours ago, thanks tho lol

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Making items PKP to Wear [Medium]
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

find,

public boolean wearItem in ItemAssistant

Under it add,

if ((wearID == ITEM_ID) && (c.pkPoints <= 1000)) { c.sendMessage("You need 1000, pkPoints to wear this."); return false; }

That should work.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Making items PKP to Wear [Medium]
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

I made it to this, but i get errors when i compile so im still working on it.

case 13896: } else if(c.pkPoints = 100)) { c.defenceLevelReq = 78; return; } else { c.sendMessage("You need 1000 pkp to wear this"); c.sendMessage("and 78 defence."); return false;

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Making items PKP to Wear [Medium]

item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

oops typed it up to fast try this

if(c.pkpoints > 1000) { } else { c.sendMessage("You need 1000 pkp to wear this");

if it doesnt work show me the method of where the req are for vesta

Erm in like itemAssistabt.java, make whereeve the I’d is so like
ID == 13645;
C.pkPoints == 1000:
Else;
C.sendmessage(“sorry, you need 1000 pk points to wear this”);
Return;
Sorry for crappy code, but I am using iPod to type this. But something like that should work.
